text:
labour if:
• You have previously had 
a baby with invasive GBS 
infection.
• GBS has been found in 
your urine in your current 
pregnancy.
• GBS has been found on 
swabs from your vagina 
which have been taken for 
another reason during this 
pregnancy.
• You have a high 
temperature during labour.
• You have an infection of 
the membranes around the 
baby (Chorioamnionitis). 
Screening for GBS
In Northern Ireland, as in the 
rest of the UK, routine testing 
for GBS in pregnancy is not 
currentl
